s: In that year, Juan and Jose Crusellas, two brothers from Catalonia, Spain, opened a factory which produced soap and candles. By the mid-1880s, Crusellas had already registered two brands which would make it famous in pre-Castro Cuba, "Hiel de Vaca" (soap) and "Rhunquiquina" (hair tonic).
